meanings.type: Noun, Noun, used as a suffix, Na-adjective (keiyodoshi)
meanings.meaning: 1. authority; expert; connoisseur; well-informed person コーヒー通の人達に結構評判がいいそうです。I hear that it has quite the reputation with coffee connoisseurs.
2. counter for messages, letters, notes, documents, etc. ここにあなたあての手紙が何通かあります。Here are some letters for you.
3. understanding (esp. of male-female relations); tact; insight
4. supernatural powers; magical powers

sentences.translation: I hear that it has quite the reputation with coffee connoisseurs.
Here are some letters for you.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ru' ending, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 1. to go by; to go past; to go along; to travel along; to pass through; to use (a road); to take (a route); to go via; to go by way of 私は毎日その教会の前を通る。I go by that church every day.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ru' ending, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 2. to run (between; of a rail service, bus route, etc.); to operate (between); to connect 駅と飛行機の間は、バスが通っている。Buses run between the station and the airport.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ru' ending, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 3. to go indoors; to go into a room; to be admitted; to be shown in; to be ushered in; to come in

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ru' ending, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 4. to penetrate; to pierce; to skewer; to go through; to come through 弾がヘルメットを通った。A bullet pierced the helmet.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ru' ending, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 5. to permeate; to soak into; to spread throughout

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ru' ending, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 6. to carry (e.g. of a voice); to reach far ケリーの声は、よく通る。Kelly's voice carries well.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ru' ending, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 7. to be passed on (e.g. of a customer's order to the kitchen); to be relayed; to be conveyed

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ru' ending, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 8. to pass (a test, a bill in the House, etc.); to be approved; to be accepted 容易に試験に通ると思う。I expect her to pass the examination easily.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ru' ending, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 9. to go by (a name); to be known as; to be accepted as; to have a reputation for 彼女はベスという名で通っていた。She went by the name of Bess.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ru' ending, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 10. to be coherent; to be logical; to be reasonable; to be comprehensible; to be understandable; to make sense そういう言い訳はとおらない。That's no excuse.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ru' ending, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 11. to get across (e.g. of one's point); to be understood 黙っていて心が通った。There was no need for verbal communication.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ru' ending, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 12. to pass for; to come across as; to seem like この絵は本物で通るだろう。This painting will pass for genuine.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ru' ending, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 13. to be straight (e.g. wood grain)

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ru' ending, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 14. to be well-informed; to be wise Archaic
15. to do ... completely; to do ... thoroughly after the -masu stem of a verb
徹る 【とおる】、透る 【とおる】

sentences.translation: I go by that church every day.
Buses run between the station and the airport.
A bullet pierced the helmet.
Kelly's voice carries well.
I expect her to pass the examination easily.
She went by the name of Bess.
That's no excuse.
There was no need for verbal communication.
This painting will pass for genuine.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'u' ending, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 1. to go to and from (a place); to go back and forth between; to run between (e.g. bus, train, etc.); to ply between

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'u' ending, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 2. to go to (school, work, etc.); to attend; to commute; to frequent ６歳以上の子供は学校に通わなければならない。Children of six and above should attend school.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'u' ending, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 3. to circulate (e.g. blood, electricity); to be communicated (e.g. thought) See also 血が通う, See also 心が通う

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'u' ending, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 4. to resemble

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'u' ending, Intransitive verb

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'u' ending, Intransitive verb

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'u' ending, Intransitive verb

sentences.translation: Children of six and above should attend school.

meanings.meaning: 1. street; road; avenue; thoroughfare この通りに沿って行けば駅に着きます。If you follow this street, you will get to the station.
2. traffic; coming and going この横町は人の通りが多い。This cross street is busy with pedestrian traffic.
3. flow (of water, air, etc.); passage; running この煙突は通りが悪くなった。This chimney has begun to draw badly.
4. transmission (of sound); reach (of voice)
5. reputation; favor; favour; popularity
6. understanding; comprehension; comprehensibility; clarity
7. the same way (as); as (follows, stated, expected, etc.) 人々は必ずしも表面に表われた通りではない。People are not always what they seem.
8. counter for sets of things
9. counter for methods, ways, kinds, etc. それは２通りに解釈できる。That reads two different ways.
10. Toori
1. street; road; avenue; thoroughfare この通りに沿って行けば駅に着きます。If you follow this street, you will get to the station.
2. traffic; coming and going この横町は人の通りが多い。This cross street is busy with pedestrian traffic.
3. flow (of water, air, etc.); passage; running この煙突は通りが悪くなった。This chimney has begun to draw badly.
4. transmission (of sound); reach (of voice)
5. reputation; favor; favour; popularity
6. understanding; comprehension; comprehensibility; clarity
7. the same way (as); as (follows, stated, expected, etc.) 人々は必ずしも表面に表われた通りではない。People are not always what they seem.
8. counter for sets of things
9. counter for methods, ways, kinds, etc. それは２通りに解釈できる。That reads two different ways.
10. Toori

sentences.translation: If you follow this street, you will get to the station.
This cross street is busy with pedestrian traffic.
This chimney has begun to draw badly.
People are not always what they seem.
That reads two different ways.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'su' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 1. to stick through; to force through その子はどうしても自分のわがままを通そうとしている。The boy will have his own way.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'su' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 2. to spread throughout; to thoroughly diffuse

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'su' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 3. to make a path between two points

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'su' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 4. to proceed in a logical manner See also 筋を通す すじをとおす

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'su' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 5. to let pass; to allow through

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'su' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 6. to lead (someone) into (a house, room, etc.); to show in

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'su' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 7. to go through (a middleman)

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'su' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 8. to (look, listen) through (a window, wall, etc.)

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'su' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 9. to pass (a law, applicant, etc.) 参議院はどんな改正案も通さなくても構わないようです。The Upper House seems bent on defeating any reform bills.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'su' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 10. to force to accept; to force agreement

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'su' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 11. to continue (in a state); to persist in

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'su' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 12. to do to the entirety of; to cover all of; to span the whole ...

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'su' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 13. to do from beginning to end without a break in the form とおして…する

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'su' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 14. to convey (one's ideas, etc.) to the other party

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'su' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 15. to do to the end; to carry through; to complete after the -te form of a verb
徹す 【とおす】、透す 【とおす】

meanings.meaning: 1. passing through (a tunnel, station, town, etc.); passing by (e.g. of a typhoon); transit 通過する車に気をつけなさい。Watch out for passing cars.
2. passage (of a bill, e.g. through parliament); carriage 予算案は上院を通過した。The budget passed the Upper House.
3. passing (an examination, inspection, etc.); clearing; getting through (a preliminary round); qualification
1. passing through (a tunnel, station, town, etc.); passing by (e.g. of a typhoon); transit 通過する車に気をつけなさい。Watch out for passing cars.
2. passage (of a bill, e.g. through parliament); carriage 予算案は上院を通過した。The budget passed the Upper House.
3. passing (an examination, inspection, etc.); clearing; getting through (a preliminary round); qualification

sentences.translation: Watch out for passing cars.
The budget passed the Upper House.

1. (common) use (of a language, currency, etc.); current use; circulation; currency; validity (e.g. of a ticket)

2. to be accepted (e.g. of a way of thinking); to work (of an excuse, trick, etc.); to hold true (e.g. of a theory); to apply; to be valid; to pass (for); to do well; to get by 彼は年の割に若く見えるので、大学生として通用します。He looks so young for his age that he passes for a college student.
3. going in and out; entrance and exit See also 通用口

sentences.translation: He looks so young for his age that he passes for a college student.

meanings.type: Noun which may take the genitive case particle 'no', Na-adjective (keiyodoshi)
meanings.meaning: 1. normal; ordinary; regular; usual; common; average 日曜日は私にとって普通の日ではない。Sunday is not an ordinary day to me.
2. normally; ordinarily; usually; generally; commonly 彼女は普通９時に寝る。She usually goes to bed at nine.
3. local train; train that stops at every station Abbreviation, See also 普通列車
4. Normality (behavior) Normality (also known as normalcy) is the state of being ... Read more

sentences.translation: Sunday is not an ordinary day to me.
She usually goes to bed at nine.
